EXTRACTED VALUE: With decent graphics, and decent (if unintuitive) gameplay, there are many small flaws, but the only HUGE flaw here is the atrocious music.
The game lacks the depth and flexibility available in other racing titles, but it captures the NASCAR experience expertly.
The game structure is a complete mess. The player has no idea what to do, when and where. [Aug 2006, p.52]
Still, you've got to be a real fanboy to want to mash your way through all two dozen or so of its missions. [July 2006, p.84]
Hacking enemies to pieces never seems to get old. That said, the sequel offers little challenge and doesn't take very long to complete.
